verses.name: Song of Songs 4:4
verses.text: Thy neck is like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.

verses.name: Song of Songs 4:5
verses.text: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

verses.name: Song of Songs 4:6
verses.text: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.

verses.name: Song of Songs 4:7
verses.text: Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee.
